most_active_tickets.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
I'm unable to do Handshake with asana

Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
Copilot is not giving any feedback
Bug: unable to cancel the download of an LLLM

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop and Copilot not responding after update
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop and Copilot become unresponsive after updating to recent versions on Windows and Linux. Issues include app failing to launch, getting stuck during loading, and Copilot not responding in conversations. Troubleshooting steps like restarting, reinstalling, and checking logs have not resolved the problems. Some users report partial functionality like conversation summaries updating despite unresponsiveness.

related_issues.title: Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
related_issues.text:
Pieces Desktop not Launching on my Windows PC
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows 11 Home, 24H2

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.2.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces Desktop application has refused to launch since updating it to the latest version (v4.0.0). It's stuck in the "Ensure Core Dependencies" loading state even though I have Pieces OS already running successfully in the background. Kindly find screenshots below. 

I've tried force quitting both Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop from my Task Manager, uninstalling and re-installing Pieces Desktop, and restarting my PC, all to no avail. Any help would be highly appreciated, thank you!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/22c14a42-29d6-4a1f-ab34-51ba5074b38e)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/025d2e80-78be-480c-9cc2-a85a440dcf75)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/48c76dde-307a-4451-b85f-0483b74c2321)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Copilot not responding
related_issues.text:
Copilot not responding
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS: 11.3.3 - Pieces for Developers: 4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Integrations and Copilot Failures
common_issues.description: Users report failures with Pieces integrations (Asana handshake) and Copilot unresponsiveness across desktop and extensions.  Copilot exhibits continuous loading, occasional summary updates, and Sentry errors in logs. Asana integration fails during handshake with "failed to do handshake" error.  HTTP 500 errors observed during login on Linux. Troubleshooting includes resets, restarts, reinstalls, and switching LLMs.

related_issues.title: I'm unable to do Handshake with asana
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
related_issues.text:
OS: login does not work ( /os/sign_in HTTP 500)
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.3.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I try to log in via PFD, the spinner loads indefinitely before opening an error page in the browser:

https://pieces.app/authentication-error?sentry_id=00000000000000000000000000000000&os=bb009f04-7e79-44cb-8376-aba647cd2c98&platform=linux

In the OS logs (Documents/com.pieces.os/Support/logs) I see this entry:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
```

It is surrounded by HTTP 200s like this:

```
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:53.075570  0:00:00.000685 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.038635  0:00:00.001700 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.043187  0:00:00.000732 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:54.335453  0:00:00.001876 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:56.077590  0:00:00.000695 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:52:59.079649  0:00:00.000662 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.081551  0:00:00.000486 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:02.391819  0:00:01.425625 POST    [500] /os/sign_in: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.272493  0:00:00.001839 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.334258  0:00:00.000938 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:04.457128  0:00:00.001378 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:05.083569  0:00:00.000541 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.085902  0:00:00.000518 GET     [200] /.well-known/version: port:39301
[D]  2025-04-17T15:53:08.094713  0:00:00.001812 POST    [200] /websites/exists: port:39300
```
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop fails to launch or connect to Pieces OS
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop application failing to launch or connect to Pieces OS across different operating systems (Windows, Linux). Issues include "Invalid port" errors, indefinite loading at the "Verify Dependency Connections" step, and HTTP 500 errors during login.  Suggested solutions include checking Pieces OS port configuration, reinstalling Pieces Desktop, and verifying Pieces OS is running correctly.

related_issues.title: Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
related_issues.text:
Invalid port http://0.0.0.0:null/connect
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

3.3.8 2025-02-17

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Pieces for Developers hangs on first run in third step (Verify Dependency Connections) with error message

unable to open Pieces Core Services
formatexception: Invalid port (at character 16)
http://0.0.0.0:null/connect

Pieces OS seems to work fine, for a brief moment I can see its window with information that the service is active on some port. Then window closes - it is impossible to bring it back, but icon in the  system tray is still there.

How can I set proper port value for Pieces for Developer, and what is the default port value?
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces for Windows: Extension and App Functionality Issues
common_issues.description: Multiple users report issues with Pieces for Windows, including VS 2022 extension conflicts affecting Diagnostic Tools, Copilot unresponsiveness in conversations and extensions, and Desktop app failing to launch past "Ensure Core Dependencies" after update.  Suggested troubleshooting includes disabling extensions, checking logs, reinstalling apps, and restarting systems. Further investigation into Pieces OS and app compatibility is needed.

related_issues.title: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output
related_issues.text: Visual Studio 2022 extension interfering with Diagnostic tool output ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Visual Studio ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version PiecesOS 11.3.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. The Diagnostic tools pane that, by default, opens when you begin debugging in Visual Studio ends up entirely blank with the Pieces plugin enabled in Visual Studio Version 17.14.0 Preview 4.0. Disabling the plugin restores the Diagnostic tools output. common_issues.title: Local and Cloud LLM Model Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with both locally hosted and cloud-based LLMs.  Symptoms include failure to install local models, Copilot unresponsiveness, and continuous loading.  A common error message points to a 404 for the Gemini Pro model.  Suggested troubleshooting includes checking model validity and project access.

related_issues.title: Copilot not responding
related_issues.text:
Copilot not responding
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS: 11.3.3 - Pieces for Developers: 4.1.1

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey all,
Pieces Copilot no longer responds in conversations in the app, or through any of the extensions (VS Code/Chrome). It just keeps loading. I've tried hard-resetting, restarting, reinstalling, On-Device LLMs, and Cloud LLMs. The weird thing is, some of the conversations will have a summary or will update the name of the conversation, but it never responds in the chat. I looked at the logs and saw repeated Sentry Event Errors, but not sure what to do with that.  I attached the log file from the day before yesterday (yesterday's is too large and won't upload). What should I do?

Thanks!

[log-04292025.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/19997109/log-04292025.txt)
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces Desktop and Copilot not responding after update" issue, focusing on Windows and Linux given the high frequency and impact on core functionality.
Investigate the root cause of Copilot unresponsiveness across desktop and extensions, addressing the potential connection to LLM model issues (both local and cloud-based) and Sentry errors.
Address Pieces Desktop launch failures, focusing on "Invalid port" errors and dependency connection problems on Linux and Windows. Review Pieces OS and app compatibility.
Improve Asana integration handshake reliability, addressing the "failed to do handshake" error and potential conflicts with Pieces for Windows extensions.
Review and address HTTP 500 errors during login on Linux, impacting Pieces OS and Desktop app connectivity.
Investigate VS 2022 extension conflicts affecting Diagnostic Tools on Windows and ensure compatibility with Pieces Desktop.
Improve communication with users experiencing Copilot and Desktop app issues, providing updates and workarounds while fixes are being developed.
Monitor and address local LLM model installation failures on Linux and investigate the 404 error related to the Gemini Pro model.
Consider adding more detailed logging and error reporting to Pieces OS and Desktop applications to aid in troubleshooting and identifying root causes of issues.
Proactively monitor support tickets for emerging trends and prioritize issues based on frequency, severity, and user impact to optimize support operations efficiency.
